description: From Middle English swire, from Old English swēora, from Proto-Germanic *swerhô.

entries.meaning: A hollow between two hills or peaks, especially with a road running through it; a vale.
examples: As he approached the swire at the head of the dell  […] , he beheld, to his astonishment, a bright halo in the cloud of haze, that rose in a semi-circle over his head like a pale rainbow.
